TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {4826=With a whopping 1440 rooms, this summer palace is the perfect example of European opulence. While the palace itself is impressive, the immaculately maintained gardens featuring statues, sculptures, fountains, flower beds and a hedge maze are a horticultural delight., 988=Sunshine generally prevails from June to September, making it the ideal time to visit for cycling and hiking in the Alps and sightseeing in the cities. During the summer months, visitors can expect warm days and cool nights with less rain than in the other months. Snow typically falls from December to March (especially in the alpine areas) so this is the best time for snow sports like skiing and snowboarding.}
textBeforeTable: Recommended reading Further reading 8. Please ask and receive permission before taking photos of people, including children. 7. Refrain from supporting businesses that exploit or abuse endangered animals. 6. Shop for locally made products. Supporting local artisans helps keep traditional crafts alive. 5. Learn some local language and don't be afraid to use it - simple greetings will help break the ice. 4. When bargaining at markets, stay calm, be reasonable and keep a smile on your face. It's meant to be fun! 3. Always dispose of litter thoughtfully, including cigarette butts. 2. For environmental reasons, try to avoid buying bottled water. Instead, fill a reusable water bottle or canteen with filtered water. 1. Be considerate of Austria’s customs, traditions, religion and culture. Top responsible travel tips for Austria Intrepid is committed to travelling in a way that is respectful of local people, their culture, local economies and the environment. It's important to remember that what may be acceptable behaviour, dress and language in your own country, may not be appropriate in another. Please keep this in mind while travelling. Austria Travel Tips Responsible Travel also provides useful health information: Go to:
